Questions.QuestionString: The fire detection loops on PW1100G engines are:
Answers: Dual loops
Single loops
Single loops on pylon area, the other areas are dual loops

Questions.QuestionString: Fire detectors on PW1100G engine are located at:
Answers: Pylon area, fan area, core area
Pylon area, AGB area, core area
Fan area, AGB area, core area

Questions.QuestionString: The fire detectors of each fire detection loop on PW1100G engine are:
Answers: Parallel connected
Serial connected
Not connected together

Questions.QuestionString: Where are the Engine fire components located?
Answers: On the Fan and the Turbine and Pylon
On the left and right side of engine core, along the main gearbox and low pressure turbine
On the left and right side of engine core, along the main gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: How many fire/overheat detectors does the Engine fire/overheat detection system comprise of?
What does the Engine fire/overheat detector assembly have?
Answers: An alarm switch
An integrity switch
An alarm switch that reacts to temperature and pressure, and an integrity switch that responds to pressure

Questions.QuestionString: How is the Alarm switch of Engine fire/overheat detector operate?
Answers: Operating on the principle that pressure decrease with a rise in temperature...
Operating on the principle that pressure increase with a rise in temperature...
Operating on the principle that pressure increase with a rise in temperature...

Questions.QuestionString: In the normal condition, the status of Alarm switch and Integrity switch is:
Answers: Alarm switch is in opened position, Integrity switch is in closed position
Alarm switch is in opened position, Integrity switch is in opened position
Alarm switch is in closed position, Integrity switch is in closed position
Causing the fast release of a large amount of gas from the special core material...
Causing the fast release of a large amount of gas from the special core material...
Causing the fast release of a large amount of gas from the special core material...

Questions.QuestionString: How the Integrity switch in the responder housing is kept closed position?
Answers: By normal gas pressure in the sensor element
By airflow pressure from LPC
By electrical relay

Questions.QuestionString: In case of the gas leakage:
Answers: The subsequent pressure increase will cause the integrity switch to close, signaling a fault malfunction to the flight deck
The subsequent pressure decrease will cause the integrity switch to close, signaling a fault malfunction to the flight deck
The subsequent pressure decrease will cause the integrity switch to open, signaling a fault malfunction to the flight deck

Questions.QuestionString: The engine fire protection is fulfilled by:
Answers: The FIRE detection system only
The FIRE detection system and the FIRE extinguishing system
The FIRE extinguishing system only

Questions.QuestionString: The responder of engine fire loop has a chamber connected to two pressure switches:
Answers: An ALARM switch and a FIRE switch
A MONITOR switch and an INTEGRITY switch
An ALARM switch and an INTEGRITY switch

Questions.QuestionString: On each engine, 2 continuous loops for the fire detection and each loop contains:
Answers: 3 fire detectors connected in parallel and connected to a different channel of the FDU
2 fire detectors connected in parallel and connected to a different channel of the FDU
3 fire detectors connected in series and connected to a different channel of the FDU

Questions.QuestionString: The fire extinguishing system of each PW1100G engine comprises of:
Answers: 02 fire extinguishing bottles, 01 SQUIB P/B switch
02 fire extinguishing bottles, 02 SQUIB P/B switches
01 fire extinguishing bottle, 02 SQUIB P/B switches

Questions.QuestionString: The 3 PW fire detectors are located:
Answers: Around the AGB, in the Core between the fuel nozzles and the aft circumferential ventilation outlet, at the pylon above the combustion chamber
Around the AGB, in the Core between the fuel nozzles and the aft circumferential ventilation outlet, at around ventilation exit grid of the fan compartment
Around the AGB, in the Core between the fuel nozzles and around ventilation exit grid of the fan compartment, at the pylon above the combustion chamber
